intro: Piper puberulinerva, commonly known as the hairy-veined pepper vine, is a tropical climbing plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Piperaceae family, which includes many species of pepper plants. The plant is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves with prominent, hairy veins, giving it its common name. Its small, greenish-white flowers are typically borne in clusters, and it produces small, edible berries that are sometimes used in local cuisines. The plant thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of tropical rainforests.
